item.title: My Data Adventure in Three Words: FML
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
Twenty eight data sets: that is the amount of data we had to look through to get an interesting slice of insight into South African professionals leaving the country to work abroad. To say that data journalism is the next critical form of storytelling in reporting and that it will eventually transform the way all news rooms operate would be a […]

The post My Data Adventure in Three Words: FML appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The Forgotten People
item.dc:creator: Lailah Ryklief
item.description:
Thousands of people in 97 informal settlements were not counted in the 2011 census, a data-driven investigation has revealed.

The post The Forgotten People appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The exodus of teachers from SA is not slowing down
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
SA is losing thousands of teachers annually, and most are headed to the United Kingdom. Teachers battling to get by in SA are opting to relocate to the UK, Australia, Canada and other countries where they can earn better salaries, save money or make enough to pay off their debts, according to data analysis conducted […]

The post The exodus of teachers from SA is not slowing down appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.
